title: How to Make Rewena Bread

steps.headline: Cook the potatoes by boiling or steaming.
Mash the potatoes.
steps.description: Mash with very little liquid (use a bit of the cooking water if needed). The mash should be on the dry side, not sloppy. Do not add milk, oil or flavorings to the mash.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.
steps.description: Grease or line the loaf tins/pans.

steps.headline: Mix the yeast, warm water and 3 tablespoons of sugar in a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Set aside in a warm place to rise.

steps.headline: Mix the flour and remaining handfuls of sugar together.
steps.description: Add the yeast mixture and the potato mash. Stir through.

steps.headline: Turn the bread dough onto a floured work surface or board.
steps.description: Knead the dough until it feels springy.

steps.headline: Break the dough in half.
steps.description: Place into the greased loaf tins/pans.

steps.headline: Make 2 cuts across the top of each loaf of bread.
Place the loaves into the oven to bake.
steps.description: Bake for half an hour or until the top of the bread turns golden brown.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Cool on wire cooling racks. The bread can be served hot or cooled.

tyn: Strainer or colander for draining potatoes
2 mixing bowls, one small and one large
Floured work surface or bread board
2 loaf tins/pans, greased or lined (parchment/baking paper)
